text.section: The Office is headed by a Chief Administrative Law Judge appointed by the Governor with the advice and consent of the Senate.

The Chief Administrative Law Judge shall:
be appointed for a term of 6 years;
devote full time to the duties of the Office; and
be eligible for reappointment.

The Chief Administrative Law Judge shall:
receive the salary provided in the State budget;
be admitted to practice law in the State; and
have the powers and duties specified in this subtitle.
The Chief Administrative Law Judge may employ a staff in accordance with the State budget.
